alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 6:01AM EST until January 10 at 4:16AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Greenwood, Newberry and Saluda Counties. Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Newberry and Union Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 121.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:00 AM EST Saturday was 122.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 111.5 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 700 AM EST.
